newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian banking head sees room for rate cuts.
newsitem.headline: Italian banking head sees room for rate cuts.

text.p: The chairman of the Italian Banking Association (ABI), Tancredi Bianchi, said on Thursday he saw room for a drop in short-term interest rates.
"The recent trend in interest rates has brought about a general lowering of the cost of money, above all in reference to medium and long-term rates," Bianchi said in a statement.
"The conditions are emerging whereby this effect could be extended to short-term interest rates," he added.

His statement followed a call earlier on Thursday by Prime Minister Romano Prodi, who said that economic recovery was not ensured by low inflation and urged Italian banks to lower their lending rates.

Figures released on Thursday showed Italian consumer price inflation fell in November to 2.6 percent year-on-year from 3.0 percent in October, the lowest since June 1969. -- Rome newsroom 396 678 2505
